As an AI language model, I don't have access to real-time data or specific insights into company wellness programs. However, I can provide examples of wellness program initiatives that have been designed to be inclusive:

1. On-Demand Sessions: Some companies offer on-demand sessions that allow employees to participate in wellness programs at their own pace and schedule, making the program accessible to everyone.

2. Virtual Programs: Virtual workshops, classes, and groups can help bring employees together regardless of their location or shift. This can be particularly beneficial for those who have little or no access to the company's wellness program onsite.

3. Health & Wellness Fairs: Companies can host health and wellness fairs that offer employees access to various health screenings, resources, and tips on how to improve their physical and mental wellbeing. Participants can seek information on diet and exercise, mindfulness and stress reduction, and other wellness-related topics.

4. Support Groups: Wellness programs that offer support groups can provide a safe and supportive environment for employees to discuss specific health needs and connect with others who share similar experiences.

5. Interpreter Services: Wellness programs that offer interpreter services provide access to information for employees who may not speak the same language as the program's facilitator or instructor.

These are just a few examples of wellness programs that have been designed to be inclusive. Companies should tailor their wellness programs to meet the unique needs of their employees to create an environment where everyone feels welcome and supported.
